website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight pair of gloves offering sufficient mobility and an attractive design.
pros: Outside pocket on back of hand can house small heater or other items
Customers appreciate their stylish, non-bulky look
cons: Tend to run a little tight
Extra liner inside glove tends to come out every time hands are removed

customer_reviews.title: Lining pulled out after 4 days on the slope. Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: For the first few days of use, these gloves worked well, fit well, and I thought, worked well. Unfortunately, on the 4th day of using them on a ski trip, the linings on both gloves pulled themselves out of the gloves. It makes them functional impossible to take on and off on the mountain. I can't recommend these gloves, given how quickly they fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Newport

customer_reviews.title: These are terrible!
customer_reviews.text: The lining sticks to your fingers then you can't get them back in. The fit is terrible. I bought them for Christmas but used them for the first time in March but had to buy other ones on the slopes...too late to return them~!
customer_reviews.author: Al Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves I've ever had...
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. I was just using them out on the slopes this weekend and was more than comfortable the entire time. I had taken out the inner lining gloves for the first part of the day and my hands did get a little cold, but once I started using the inserts too, my hands were very warm. Never had any issues with wetness either. Great grip too!
customer_reviews.author: Jonnypants

customer_reviews.title: B+
customer_reviews.text: Runs a bit small based on the hand width chart - note that the inner gloves are thick, so buy one size up. Also a bit snug to pull onto your hand, but online ratings are very high. And looks to be durable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are garbage. Save your money and buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: The fingers pull out when you take your hands out and they are impossible to get back in. I could not get my fingers back in so I cut the liner out and inside they use plastic bags for their "insane membrane". The plastic bags were what gets jammed up in the fingers making it impossible to fit your fingers back in. These gloves are garbage. Save your money and buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Porter

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Always amazed with burton products. I've ridden and worn burton for 26 years never let down. R.I.P. Jake we all owe you for this amazing sport!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive gloves for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Decent inexpensive gloves. I used them for 5 days of snowboarding in Colorado, they worked well, especially with the under-glove. They wore out pretty quickly, I would probably need to get new gloves before I go again. If you are a beginner I recommend these, they will not break the bank but you will not be left with frozen hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for one day!!
customer_reviews.text: The straps (for keeping the gloves attached to you hands when not wearing them) are too loose, I lost a glove because they slipped off my wrist and fell when I was going up the lift. The size wasn’t a good fit even though I bought a large. I had snow in my hands/inner gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Schubert

customer_reviews.title: nice fit. i like the option of just wearing ...
customer_reviews.text: nice fit. i like the option of just wearing the inner liner for warm days, the outer layer for cold days, and that you can pair the inner liner with the outer glove for extra cold days. i also like how it can tuck easily under your snowboarding jacked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality and not to expensive. Even in the ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality and not to expensive. Even in the snow these gloves really hold up and for $30 I might get these for the rest of my family for christmas.
customer_reviews.author: collegesucks

customer_reviews.title: Outer glove is nice, inner glove is nothing special and can be replaced if needed.
customer_reviews.text: Fit well for me, touch screen fingers work as well as to be expected. The only thing is that the material of the inner glove likes to catch on the velcro, when adjusting it. In this respect, the Burton 2-in-1 Over gloves might be better with it's pull-tab to tighten. At least the inner glove is replaceable if it rips/degrades, but the outer glove seems pretty high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Snowboard gloves
customer_reviews.text: Really nice gloves! I bought these for my son for Christmas and loved them! He has already used them to go snowboarding and he said they kept his hands nice and toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Nicer than I even expected. My dad will be able to use them for his outside chores. It gets very cold where he lives and these will keep his hands warm and protected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps warm and features the latest technology (like touchscreen capability)
customer_reviews.text: Terrific gloves for outdoor sports, shoveling and keeping warm. The pockets are plenty big enough for hand warmers and put the heat in just the right spot to keep the blood circulating. I like the length of the wrist cuff - not too long but long enough that snow is finding its way inside the glove. The inner glove liners are great quality and substantial enough for use on their own. Best of all, the outer gloves have sewn edges ductile enough for working but also rigid enough for touchscreen texting - a great feature!
customer_reviews.author: OlympusRan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Perfect

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Although these fit a little snug, i still give them 5 stars because that is my fault. i had a feeling i needed a large and ended up ordering the med. I have gone snowboarding about 4 times with these and have no complaints at all. They are warm, durable in the snow, and keep my hands dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got a medium cuz my hand width is like 3 1/4 or 3 1/2
customer_reviews.text: Kept my hands warm and dry all day and fit perfectly. Got a medium cuz my hand width is like 3 1/4 or 3 1/2. Touch screen capability works perfect, never had to remove my gloves to use the phone. Worth the money in my opinion.

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of snowboarding or everyday gloves
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an improvement over the previous version. I got the original pair and these I got as a gift for my best friend. The top layer is definitely thicker and they fit comfortably. They also have a great build and can withstand rainy and wet weather. Probably good up to temperatures in the 10s-20s. After that you may want to pair the other layer with a thicker inner layer. My only wish is that the inner layer should be full touch friendly like the outer one. Otherwise a great pair of everyday or snowboarding gloves.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cedano

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I didn't have too
customer_reviews.text: Threading was already coming out on the thumb of one glove upon arrival. After three days of riding threading started to come out of one of the knuckles. I can't speak to the warmth of these gloves. I'm glad I didn't have too. I will say that they can keep your hands warm and sweaty at 50 degrees F. The inner lining (not liner gloves) has the unfortunate ability to easily pull out of the glove upon removal of the hand. Even when special care is taken to remove individual fingers. The pinky always seemed to become displaced making it frustratingly difficult to put back on.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not happy with these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not happy with these gloves. They are aesthetically pleasing but the lining on the inside consistently comes out when taking your gloves off and are a pain to get back in. Also wish the under gloves were designed to be smart phone friendly. Would much rather get mittens to avoid the lining!

product_meta.title: Burton Baker 2-in-1 Under Gloves Bog Heather Mens
product_meta.description: On the surface, the men's Burton Baker 2-In-1 Under Glove might seem like just another awesome glove. Look deeper, and you'll see that it's actually a totally awesome glove that happens to love riding in the absolute crappiest conditions. A potent shot of Thermacore insulation combined with a fleece lining serves up mouthwatering heat. DRYRIDE two-layer fabric and the extra waterproof DRYRIDE Membrane 2.0 offer a refreshingly dry finish. Too warm or still cold? Control your climate with the hidden, dual-function heater/vent pocket which is built to accommodate a disposable handwarmer. Text and manage your music with the Screen Grab palm and its stealth touchscreen control across all ten fingers.
